intro: Brachyscome goniocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant produces small, narrow fruits that are distinctive in shape, contributing to its scientific name. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Brachyscome goniocarpa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
